results.title: Electronics in action
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science Topics”.
Through simple diagrams and explanations this film illustrates the role of valves, transistors, IC’s, oscillators, filters, amplifiers and microprocessors in basic electronics and discusses their application in computers, electrical appliances, sound recording and medical diagnosis.

results.title: What's in a rainbow?: making scientific models
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Goldberg-Werrenrath Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science fact and fun”.
Shows how to create a scientific model of a rainbow using a hose, stressing that the angle of the sun in the sky is an important factor in determining whether or not a rainbow appears. Introduces the ideas of reflection and refraction. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Water runs downhill: observation and inference
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath, Journal Films and Goldberg-Werrenrath Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science fact and fun”.
A number of observations concerning water are made, and from these inferences are drawn about water and gravity and the part they play in eroding and shaping the earth. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Seeds and weeds: observing plants
results.creator_credit: Reinald Werrenrath Jr and Goldberg-Werrenrath Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science fact and fun”

Points out various types of weeds and notes their effective methods of seed dispersal in terms of the particular environments in which they can survive. Introduces the process of germination and the importance of sunlight for growth.

results.title: Machines, engines and motors
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science fact and fun”.
Provides examples of simple machines such as levers, wheel and axle machines, pulleys, wedges and inclined planes. Also gives definitions of machines, motors, engines and energy. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Don't tell me I'll find out (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Quick and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science Curriculum Improvement Studies”.
Organisms: includes first grade children observing aquaria and seed planting. Lifecycles: second graders plant and observe growth of beans, also observe fruitfly in pupae and adult stages. Populations: third grade children observe crickets eating clover and chameleons eating crickets, introducing the terms predator and prey.

results.title: What would happen if...? (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Quick and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science Curriculum Improvement Studies Series”.
First grade children sort materials, and compare wood with sawdust. Second grade children experiment with objects and are introduced to the terms interaction, sub-systems and variables. Third graders find which part of a mixture changes the colour of a BTB/vinegar solution, and experiment with changing variables.

results.title: Let's try it (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Quick and University of California, Los Angeles
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Science Curriculum Improvement Studies Series”.
Fifth grade children, working with the communities unit, observed crickets in their terraria and set up experiments to find out what the crickets eat. Later children observe frogs eating some of their crickets and so on. The children’s experiences provide background for the introduction of the concept of a community.
